medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks prior to presentation. The patient had mild abdominal distension without abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting. No specific aggravating or relieving factors mentioned. A week prior, his sister-in-law developed severe diarrhea (>6 episodes per day), associated with abdominal bloating and discomfort.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Two years prior, routine blood tests showed an eosinophil count of 0.09 × 10^9/L. His sister-in-law had a routine CBC three years prior that revealed an eosinophil count of 0.1 × 10^9/L.
medical_history.family_history: Family members had negative Strongyloides serology and stool culture. No heritable conditions or similar symptoms discussed.
medical_history.social_history: The family frequently consumed raw fish (sashimi). All family members had no recent travel, no pets in the household, and did not consume home-grown or local market food.
